title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.38-39 | 16-10-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Gyanathimirandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and invocations, setting a spiritual tone.

segments.key_quote: So, the Lord, unknowingly, arranged that Narada inform Yudhishthira about the whereabouts of Dhritarashtra and Gandhari and Vidura.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the context of the verses, explaining Narada's appearance as a divine arrangement to inform Yudhishthira about his relatives.

segments.key_quote: The way of devotional service is not only to worship the Supreme Lord with all devotion, but also to worship the pure devotee spiritual master, the Acharya, on the same level as the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains why Narada is referred to as Bhagavan, emphasizing the importance of honoring pure devotees and their role in preaching.

segments.key_quote: Actually a living being cannot be a non-devotee of the Lord because of his constitutional position.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the inherent devotional nature of all beings and highlights preaching to non-devotees as the highest form of service.

segments.key_quote: Such people who, devotees, pure devotees, who preach the glories of the Lord among the non-devotees, they are actually the most munificent.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the generosity of those who preach and the importance of offering respect to pure devotees like Narada.

segments.key_quote: O godly personality I do not know where my two uncles have gone nor can I find out my ascetic aunt who is grief-stricken by the loss of all her sons.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the next verse where Yudhishthira inquires about the whereabouts of his relatives, highlighting his concern and grief.

segments.key_quote: Gandhari is an exceptional personality described in the history called Mahabharata because she was living the life of an ascetic even though she was living in a palace.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Gandhari's exceptional character as an ascetic, highlighting her tolerance and devotion.

segments.key_quote: In the material world, while we have taken up the path of devotional service, we have declared a war against Maya.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Gandhari's wise counsel and the importance of tolerance in the face of difficulties encountered on the path of devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Gandhari is described as she was an ideal woman as mother, wife, and ascetic and in the history of the world such character in a woman is rarely found.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing Gandhari's exemplary qualities as an ideal woman and her unwavering fairness, even in difficult circumstances.
